inspirationalQuotes.text: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
inspirationalQuotes.author: William Osler

inspirationalQuotes.text: Wherever the art of medicine is loved, there is also a love of humanity.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Hippocrates

inspirationalQuotes.text: The art of medicine consists of amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.
inspirationalQuotes.author: Voltaire

paretoBanner.title: Master the 20%
paretoBanner.description: Focus on the high-yield topics that make up 80% of your exams.

questionOfTheDay.question: A 55-year-old male presents with sudden-onset chest pain radiating to his left arm. ECG shows ST-segment elevation in leads V1-V4. Which coronary artery is most likely occluded?

caseStudies.title: A Case of Persistent Cough
caseStudies.scenario: A 68-year-old male with a 40-pack-year smoking history presents with a persistent cough for the past 3 months, accompanied by weight loss and occasional hemoptysis.
caseStudies.question: What is the most important initial investigation?
caseStudies.explanation: A Chest X-ray is the most crucial initial step to evaluate for potential lung malignancy in a patient with these risk factors and symptoms.

subjects.name: Anatomy
subjects.description: The study of the structure of the human body, from macroscopic to microscopic levels.

subjects.name: Physiology
subjects.description: The science of the function of living systems. It explores how organisms, organ systems, organs, cells, and biomolecules carry out the chemical or physical functions that exist in a living system.

subjects.name: Biochemistry
subjects.description: The study of chemical processes within and relating to living organisms. A sub-discipline of both chemistry and biology, biochemistry may be divided into three fields: structural biology, enzymology and metabolism.

subjects.name: Pathology
subjects.description: The study of the causes and effects of disease or injury. The word pathology also refers to the study of disease in general, incorporating a wide range of biology research fields and medical practices.

subjects.name: Microbiology
subjects.description: The scientific study of microorganisms, those being unicellular (single cell), multicellular (cell colony), or acellular (lacking cells).

subjects.name: Pharmacology
subjects.description: A branch of medicine, biology and pharmaceutical sciences concerned with drug or medication action, where a drug may be defined as any artificial, natural, or endogenous molecule which exerts a biochemical or physiological effect on the cell, tissue, organ, or organism.

subjects.name: Community Medicine
subjects.description: A branch of medicine that is concerned with the health of the members of a community, municipality, or region. It focuses on the prevention of disease and the promotion of health in a population.

subjects.name: Forensic Medicine
subjects.description: The application of medical knowledge to the investigation of crime, particularly in establishing the causes of injury or death.

subjects.name: ENT
subjects.description: Otorhinolaryngology (ENT) is a surgical subspecialty within medicine that deals with the surgical and medical management of conditions of the head and neck.

subjects.name: Ophthalmology
subjects.description: A branch of medicine that deals with the diagnosis and treatment of eye disorders.

subjects.name: General Medicine
subjects.description: The medical specialty dealing with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of adult diseases.

subjects.name: General Surgery
subjects.description: A surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents including the esophagus, stomach, small intestine, large intestine, liver, pancreas, gallbladder, appendix and bile ducts, and often the thyroid gland.

subjects.name: Obstetrics & Gynaecology
subjects.description: The medical specialty that encompasses the two subspecialties of obstetrics (covering pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period) and gynecology (covering the health of the female reproductive system).

subjects.name: Pediatrics
subjects.description: The branch of medicine that involves the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents.

subjects.name: Orthopedics
subjects.description: The branch of surgery concerned with conditions involving the musculoskeletal system.

subjects.name: Radiology
subjects.description: The medical discipline that uses medical imaging to diagnose and treat diseases within the bodies of animals and humans.

subjects.name: Anesthesiology
subjects.description: The medical specialty concerned with the total perioperative care of patients before, during and after surgery.

subjects.name: Psychiatry
subjects.description: The medical specialty devoted to the diagnosis, prevention, and treatment of mental disorders.

subjects.name: Dermatology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine dealing with the skin. It is a speciality with both medical and surgical aspects.
